comments:
This sophomore-level laboratory course covers applications related to molecular biology and microfluidics. Strong emphasis is placed on instrumentation, measurement, data analysis methods, and research design. MATLAB is also used for data analysis.

Students found the lab manual to be “unclear”, “poorly written,” and “provide little value as teaching materials.” Many students felt confused as to what they were expected to do for the experiments after reading the lab manual. They commented that most of their learning comes from outside the lab manual, during research for prelabs and talking with other students and the TAs. A student also commented that MATLAB was not well-incorporated in the curriculum.

One student complimented Professor Widenbrandt as “extremely helpful in terms of stimulating students and getting us to think about the experiments.” Many students felt that the grading was unclear and inconsistent.

This six-hour laboratory course is required for BE sophomore majors, who are required to have completed BE200, BE209, and have completed or be taking concurrently MATH 241 to take this course. There is final exam in addition to an extensive final project.

This review is based on the 7 student comments which were submitted.
